page.title: 16EGLOSKERRY VILLAGE. (1)
page.content: {Egloskerry}village lies on an unclassified road five miles west of {Launceston}in Cornwall.Less than a mile to the north runs the{River {Ottery,}and the{River Kensey}runs through the southern outskirts of the village. Both rivers join the{Tamar}at Launceston. There are 40 to 50 houses in the village, and a population of 100 to 150 people.Coming from Launceston you first reach the area called Hole, where a road turns off to the next parish, North Petherwin. There are half-a-dozen houses here and a Methodist Chapel. One hundred and fifty metres further on is the main part of the village, clustered around the church, which is dedicated to St. Corantius.Opposite the church is a cul-de-sac, with half-a-dozen houses facing on to a cobbled courtyard. Next door to the church is the Post Office.
